item_prototype.name: AccessPointBootSoftware
item_prototype.description: The boot revision on the AccessPoint

item_prototype.name: AccessPointConnectionTime
item_prototype.description: The time since last authorization of the AccessPoint

item_prototype.name: AccessPointCPU
item_prototype.description: The state of the AccessPoint 7 means running

item_prototype.name: AccessPointHardware
item_prototype.description: The hardware revision on the AccessPoint

item_prototype.name: AccessPointRAMFree
item_prototype.description: The state of the AccessPoint 7 means running

item_prototype.name: AccessPointState
item_prototype.description: The state of the AccessPoint 7 means running

trigger_prototype.name: AccessPoint {#SNMPVALUE} has CPU count over 75% on {HOST.HOST}
trigger_prototype.description: The AccessPoint has been at over 75% CPU the last 5 minutes

trigger_prototype.name: AccessPoint {#SNMPVALUE} has less than 15Mb RAM free on {HOST.HOST}
trigger_prototype.description: The AccessPoint has less than 15 Mb RAM free - this calls for a reboot

trigger_prototype.name: AccessPoint {#SNMPVALUE} not runnng on {HOST.HOST}
trigger_prototype.description: The state of the AccessPoint is not 7

trigger.name: CPU load on {HOST.HOST} is above 75%
trigger.description: The last 5 checks of CPU has been higher than 75%

trigger.name: New accesspoint available
trigger.description: There is a New AccessPoint in the detected Accesspoint queue
